title: PEN-Plus Approach: WHO's Model to Combat Severe NCDs in Africa
summary: The World Health Organization's African Region has reported that 20 African countries have successfully expanded their access to critical services for severe non-communicable diseases (NCDs) through the implementation of the PEN-Plus approach.
content:
The WHO African Region has released an important report highlighting significant progress in addressing severe non-communicable diseases across the continent. According to the report, twenty African nations have successfully expanded their healthcare capabilities by implementing the PEN-Plus approach, marking a notable advancement in the fight against severe NCDs.

This strategic healthcare initiative has enabled these countries to enhance their access to critical medical services specifically designed to address severe non-communicable diseases, representing a crucial step forward in improving healthcare delivery across Africa.
